com.kuka.roboticsAPI.sensorModel

Class RecorderConfigurator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kuka.roboticsAPI.sensorModel.RecorderConfigurator

  • public final class RecorderConfigurator
extends Object
    A configurator which can be used to create a RecorderConfiguration for the IDataRecorder.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RecorderConfigurator()
      Creates a new instance of the recorder configurator.

    • Method Detail

      • recordCartesianForce

        public RecorderConfigurator recordCartesianForce(com.kuka.geometry.Frame measureFrame)
        Configures the recorder to record Cartesian forces (along axis x, y, z) in [N].

        The orientation of the measure frame is used.

        Parameters:
        measureFrame - The frame where the force measurement will take place. This frame must be statically attached to a device which can measure forces. null is not allowed.
        Returns:
        this configurator

      • recordCartesianForce

        public RecorderConfigurator recordCartesianForce(com.kuka.geometry.Frame measureFrame,
                                                 com.kuka.geometry.Frame orientationFrame)
        Configures the recorder to record Cartesian forces (along axis x, y, z) in [N].
        Parameters:
        measureFrame - The frame where the force measurement will take place. This frame must be statically attached to a device which can measure forces. null is not allowed.
        orientationFrame - The frame that specifies the orientation where the force measurement will take place. As orientationFrame any frame for which a path from measureFrame can be calculated at runtime can be used; for example a frame connected to World. null is not allowed.
        Returns:
        this configurator

      • recordCartesianTorque

        public RecorderConfigurator recordCartesianTorque(com.kuka.geometry.Frame measureFrame)
        Configures the recorder to record Cartesian torques (about axis x, y, z) in [Nm].

        The orientation of the measure frame is used.

        Parameters:
        measureFrame - The frame where the torque measurement will take place. This frame must be statically attached to a device which can measure forces. null is not allowed.
        Returns:
        this configurator

      • recordCartesianTorque

        public RecorderConfigurator recordCartesianTorque(com.kuka.geometry.Frame measureFrame,
                                                  com.kuka.geometry.Frame orientationFrame)
        Configures the recorder to record Cartesian torques (about axis x, y, z) in [Nm].
        Parameters:
        measureFrame - The frame where the torque measurement will take place. This frame must be statically attached to a device which can measure forces. null is not allowed.
        orientationFrame - The frame that specifies the orientation where the force measurement will take place. As orientationFrame any frame for which a path from measureFrame can be calculated at runtime can be used; for example a frame connected to World. null is not allowed.
        Returns:
        this configurator

      • recordInternalJointTorque

        public RecorderConfigurator recordInternalJointTorque(RoboticArm robot)
        Configures the recorder to record the internal torques of all joints of the robot.
        Parameters:
        robot - the robot whose internal joint torques are going to be recorded. null is not allowed.
        Returns:
        this configurator

      • recordExternalJointTorque

        public RecorderConfigurator recordExternalJointTorque(RoboticArm robot)
        Configures the recorder to record the external torques of all joints of the robot.
        Parameters:
        robot - the robot whose external joint torques are going to be recorded. null is not allowed.
        Returns:
        this configurator

      • recordCurrentCartesianPositionXYZ

        public RecorderConfigurator recordCurrentCartesianPositionXYZ(com.kuka.geometry.Frame measureFrame,
                                                              com.kuka.geometry.Frame referenceFrame)
        Configures the recorder to record the current Cartesian position of the specified frame.
        Parameters:
        measureFrame - The frame below or equal to the flange of the robot where the measurement takes place. null is not allowed
        referenceFrame - The positions are recorded in the coordinate system of this reference frame. null is not allowed.
        Returns:
        this configurator

      • recordCommandedCartesianPositionXYZ

        public RecorderConfigurator recordCommandedCartesianPositionXYZ(com.kuka.geometry.Frame measureFrame,
                                                                com.kuka.geometry.Frame referenceFrame)
        Configures the recorder to record the commanded Cartesian position of the specified frame.
        Parameters:
        measureFrame - The frame below or equal to the flange of the robot where the measurement takes place. null is not allowed.
        referenceFrame - The positions are recorded in the coordinate system of this reference frame. null is not allowed.
        Returns:
        this configurator

      • recordCurrentJointPosition

        public RecorderConfigurator recordCurrentJointPosition(RoboticArm robot)
        Configures the recorder to record the current positions of all joints of the robot.

        Use setAngleUnit(AngleUnit) to configure the unit the joint positions should be recorded in.

        Parameters:
        robot - the robot whose current joint positions are going to be recorded. null is not allowed.
        Returns:
        this configurator

      • recordCommandedJointPosition

        public RecorderConfigurator recordCommandedJointPosition(RoboticArm robot)
        Configures the recorder to record the commanded positions of all joints of the robot.

        Use setAngleUnit(AngleUnit) to configure the unit the joint positions should be recorded in.

        Parameters:
        robot - the robot whose commanded joint positions are going to be added. null is not allowed.
        Returns:
        this configurator

      • setAngleUnit

        public RecorderConfigurator setAngleUnit(AngleUnit angleUnit)
        Sets the angle unit to use when recording joint positions.
        Parameters:
        angleUnit - the angle unit to use
        Returns:
        this configurator
        See Also:
        recordCurrentJointPosition(RoboticArm), recordCommandedJointPosition(RoboticArm)

      • setTimeout

        public RecorderConfigurator setTimeout(long timeout,
                                       TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Sets the timeout after which the recording will be stopped. This value is used if the recording was not stopped before, either manually or by a trigger.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The maximum time to record data. A negative value means that no timeout will be used and the recording process will be stopped when the file size reaches 16MB or 30000 data sets are gathered. A zero value is not possible.
        timeUnit - The time unit of the timeout
        Returns:
        this configurator

      • setSampleInterval

        public RecorderConfigurator setSampleInterval(int sampleInterval)
        Sets the sample interval of the recorder.

        This is the time interval between two sample recordings.

        Parameters:
        sampleInterval - The sample interval in milliseconds to record data. The minimum value is 1 millisecond. It must be non-negative.
        Returns:
        this configurator

      • setFileName

        public RecorderConfigurator setFileName(String fileName)
        Sets the name of the file where the recorded data will be saved.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file to save the recording data. It only must contain the file name and not the path, and must not be null.
        Returns:
        this configurator

      • buildConfiguration

        public RecorderConfiguration buildConfiguration()
        Builds the recorder configuration.

        If angleUnit, timeout, sampleInterval or fileName are not set, the following default values are used respectively:

      • angleUnit: Radiant
      • timeout: -1 (No timeout. If not stopped via IDataRecorder.stopRecording(), the recording will stop as soon as the buffer size of 16MB is reached or 30000 data sets are gathered.), timeUnit: Milliseconds
      • sampleInterval: 1 millisecond
      • fileName: 'DataRecorder_[ID].log'. The ID will be generated at runtime.
Returns:
the recorder configuration
